Issues.Title: Convert Shell32 structs to CsWin32
Issues.Body:

- AUTOCOMPLETEOPTIONS
- BFFM
- COMDLG_FILTERSPEC
- DROPDESCRIPTION
- DROPIMAGETYPE

Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Convert Shell32 structs to CsWin32" (#7563)

Issues.Title: Please add a modern Tab control to WinForms
Issues.Body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe

The only problem is a lack of a modern Tab control, not a technical problem.

### Describe the solution you'd like and alternatives you've considered

https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/main/docs/roadmap.md told me to submit control requests here.

I would REALLY like to see WinForms gain a modern Tab control.  The Windows Tab control is, meh, ok.  But it doesn't have options like adding a close button to each tab.  See SSMS or Visual Studio for examples of modern Tab controls.

Happy to discuss specifics if needed.

### Will this feature affect UI controls?

Yes.

* Yes, designer support would be required.  
* It is a new control, I assume accessibility will be required.
* I would assume localization would also be required.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Please add a modern Tab control to WinForms" (#7562)

Issues.Body:
null

Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Merging internal commits for release/6.0" (#7560)

Issues.Title: Remove conflicting interop structs
Issues.Body:
Removed our `RECT`, `HDC`, etc structs in favor of cswin32. This necessitated changing all of the existing P/Invokes back to `[DllImport]` as the `[LibaryImport]` doesn't work with the source generated types.

- Remove all `using foo =` workarounds.
- Push forward to cswin32 daily build to address bool cast issue
- New cswin32 uses System.Drawing types where plausible (`POINT` -> `Point`, as we currently do).


###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/7561)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Remove conflicting interop structs" (#7561)

Issues.Title: Make wrapper explicit on IHandle<T>
Issues.Body:
With an explicit `IHandle<T>.Wrapper` we can avoid boxing when `IHandle<T>` is implmented on a struct and passing `IHandle<T>` to `GC.KeepAlive()`.

Issues.Title: Convert structs to CsWin32
Issues.Body:
Converted these structs:
- FormatMessageOptions
- GMEM
- LCID
- LCTYPE
- MAX_PATH
- MAX_UNICODESTRING_LEN
- SYSTEMTIME
- FILETIME

Deleted these files since they had zero references
- Interop.ACTCTXW.cs
- Interop.ACTCTX_FLAG.cs
- Interop.ProcessAccessOptions.cs
- Interop.SORT.cs
- Interop.STARTF.CS
- Interop.STARTUPINFOW.cs
- Interop.SYSTEM_POWER_STATUS.cs

Issues.Title: Introduce IHandle<T>
Issues.Body:
Add typed IHandle to keep handles typed. Add HandleRef<T> that derives from IHandle<T> to use where direct binding with IHandle<T> is not always necessary.

Port a number of User32 APIs to cswin32 to vet design.

First commit starts transitioning to global usings for interop to make porting easier.

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/7546)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Introduce IHandle<T>" (#7546)

Issues.Title: DataGridView's cell mouse tooltip does not display when the cell is not selected in specific case
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET SDK 7.0.100-rc.1.22405.9

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No, it's not a regression issue, also repro on .NET 6.0.

### Steps to reproduce

1. Open the attached solution: [DGV_DataBind_ToolTip.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/9280770/DGV_DataBind_ToolTip.zip)
2. Extract and open the project.
3. Build and run the project.
4. The DataGridView cell1 in row1 is selected by default, and the current row's cells have mouse tooltips, then hover with the mouse over next rows' cells to observe

### Current Behavior
DataGridView's cell mouse tooltips does not display when the cell is not selected in step4 except the cell text is truncated
![test789415](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/86937911/183386406-813dfbe0-6071-419e-b200-f4b0aab94937.gif)


### Expected Behavior
DataGridView's cell mouse tooltips should always display because DataGridView's ShowCellTooloTips is True.

### More Info
1. The initial feedback ticket is: https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1585331
2. This issue may be caused by: https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/1681
3. This issue cannnot repro in DataGridView without dataBind
4. .NET Framework does not support mouse tooltip.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "DataGridView's cell mouse tooltip does not display when the cell is not selected in specific case" (#7552)

Issues.Title: DragEnter_Set_DropImageType_Message_MessageReplacementToken_ReturnsExptected fails intermittently
Issues.Body:
### Test

System.Windows.Forms.UITests.DragDropTests.DragEnter_Set_DropImageType_Message_MessageReplacementToken_ReturnsExptected

### Issue description

Failed on debug x64:

```
Error message
Assert.InRange() Failure\r\nRange:  (287 - 289)\r\nActual: 208

Stack trace
   at System.Windows.Forms.UITests.ControlTestBase.MoveMouseAsync(Form window, Point point, Boolean assertCorrectLocation) in /_/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/UIIntegrationTests/Infra/ControlTestBase.cs:line 154
   at System.Windows.Forms.UITests.ControlTestBase.MoveMouseToControlAsync(Control control) in /_/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/UIIntegrationTests/Infra/ControlTestBase.cs:line 111
   at System.Windows.Forms.UITests.DragDropTests.<DragEnter_Set_DropImageType_Message_MessageReplacementToken_ReturnsExptected>b__4_1(DragDropForm form) in /_/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/UIIntegrationTests/DragDropTests.cs:line 91
   at System.Windows.Forms.UITests.ControlTestBase.<>c__DisplayClass29_0`1.<<RunFormWithoutControlAsync>b__0>d.MoveNext() in /_/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/UIIntegrationTests/Infra/ControlTestBase.cs:line 277
--- End of stack trace from previous location ---
   at Microsoft.VisualStudio.Threading.JoinableTask.JoinAsync(CancellationToken cancellationToken)
   at System.Windows.Forms.UITests.ControlTestBase.RunFormWithoutControlAsync[TForm](Func`1 createForm, Func`2 testDriverAsync) in /_/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/UIIntegrationTests/Infra/ControlTestBase.cs:line 295
   at System.Windows.Forms.UITests.DragDropTests.DragEnter_Set_DropImageType_Message_MessageReplacementToken_ReturnsExptected() in /_/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/UIIntegrationTests/DragDropTests.cs:line 56
--- End of stack trace from previous location ---
```

Issues.Title: Convert CreateX to Cswin32
Issues.Body:
Convert `CreateDIBSection`,`CreateRectRgn`,`CreateCompatibleDC`,`CreateHalftonePalette`
Add conversion for `Gdi.CreatedHDC` -> `HDC` and `Gdi.HPALETTE` <-> `HPALETTE`
Move `RegionScope`, `CreateDCScope`, and `RegionTests` files

- Some clean up

Issues.Title: Removing extra cases in GetPropertyValue from from children classes.
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Fixes #6236


## Proposed changes

- Moved returning values of the virtual properties to the base class.
- Ordered switch cases in `AccessibleObject.GetPropertyValue` alphabetically.
- Removed extra `RecnatgleBounds` overridings.
- Used switch expression instead of if blocks.

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- It's a technical refactoring.

## Regression? 

- No

## Risk

- Minimal

<!-- end TELL-MODE -->


## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

- Unit tests


 

## Test environment(s) <!-- Remove any that don't apply -->

- 7.0.100-preview.5.22307.18


<!-- Mention language, UI scaling, or anything else that might be relevant -->
